Posted By: Neutralion (2/4/2010 7:59:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like the idea of cards that are better when cycled, I really do, the idea of producing an effect that:  
  
1. Is more difficult to counter, since its an activated ability (when you *cycle* something, most cards can't counter it)  
2. Can be done at instant speed  
3. Nets you a card at the same time  
  
..sound awesome! I really do believe that if they wanted to add the flavour and have people still encouraged to play tri-coloured, a cycling cost of {1}{U}{B}{R} would have most definitely made this playable...as is though, cycling for {8}...ugh.
posts.html:

2. Can be done at instant speed

..sound awesome! I really do believe that if they wanted to add the flavour and have people still encouraged to play tri-coloured, a cycling cost of {1}{U}{B}{R} would have most definitely made this playable...as is though, cycling for {8}...ugh.

Posted By: Paladin85 (8/3/2011 11:51:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: The worst of the Resounding cycle. In late game, it is far from guaranteed that your opponent will have one card in hand, don't even mention two. So it's not worth it to wait to cycle this card. And it's not really worth the mana cost to just play it either. This card is virtually unplayable.
posts.html:
The worst of the Resounding cycle. In late game, it is far from guaranteed that your opponent will have one card in hand, don't even mention two. So it's not worth it to wait to cycle this card. And it's not really worth the mana cost to just play it either. This card is virtually unplayable.
